Key Arguments: The legislation will curb free speech, a fundamental democratic right.
There is a risk of over-censorship by tech companies to avoid penalties, affecting both facts and opinions.
Government and tech companies' decisions on misinformation have been subjective in the past.
The legislation could legitimize attempts to restrict public debate and enforce ideological conformity.
The Australian Human Rights Commission has raised concerns about the dangers of a single entity being the arbiter of truth.
Main Themes: Role of Social Media and Tech Companies
Notable Quotes: I am, however, confident that it will curb free speech.
During the Covid-19 pandemic many so-called conspiracy theories turned out later to be truth.
Efforts to combat online misinformation and disinformation could be used to legitimize attempts to restrict public debate, censor unpopular opinions and enforce ideological conformity in Australia.
